security_audit.summary: Official Anthropic skill containing only documentation and guidance files. No executable code, network operations, or filesystem modifications. Safe for marketplace distribution.

content.value_statement: Users need guidance on creating well-structured plugins that integrate with Claude Code. This skill provides comprehensive documentation on directory layout, manifest configuration, component organization, and best practices for building maintainable plugins.
actual_capabilities: Explains standardized directory structure with automatic component discovery
Details plugin.json manifest configuration including required and optional fields
Covers component organization for commands, agents, skills, and hooks
Provides guidance on implementing MCP server integration and path references
Includes reference documentation, patterns, and examples from minimal to advanced plugins
Teaches portable path references using ${CLAUDE_PLUGIN_ROOT} for cross-platform compatibility
limitations: Does not execute or validate plugin code
Does not provide interactive scaffolding or code generation
Does not interact with external systems or APIs
Assumes basic familiarity with Claude Code platform concepts

use_cases.title: Build Your First Plugin
use_cases.description: New developers learn the standardized directory layout, manifest fields, and component types needed to create a working Claude Code plugin.

use_cases.title: Establish Plugin Standards
use_cases.description: Teams create consistent plugin structures across projects using the naming conventions, organization patterns, and best practices from this skill.

use_cases.title: Add Advanced Features
use_cases.description: Experienced authors implement hooks, MCP servers, and complex component patterns using the reference documentation and examples.

prompt_templates.title: Create a Plugin
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me create a new Claude Code plugin with a proper directory structure and plugin.json manifest. Include commands, agents, skills, and hooks directories.

prompt_templates.title: Configure Manifest
prompt_templates.prompt: Explain the plugin.json fields I need to configure including name, version, description, author, and component paths. Show examples for each field.

prompt_templates.title: Organize Components
prompt_templates.prompt: How should I organize commands, agents, skills, and hooks in my plugin? What naming conventions should I use for files and directories?

prompt_templates.title: Add MCP Integration
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me how to configure MCP servers in my plugin. Include the .mcp.json format and how to reference ${CLAUDE_PLUGIN_ROOT} in server configurations.

output_examples.input: Help me create a plugin for code quality checks with commands for linting and testing, an agent for code review, and a skill for testing patterns.
output: A complete plugin structure with commands/, agents/, and skills/ directories
plugin.json with name, version, description, and metadata
lint.md and test.md commands with YAML frontmatter
testing-patterns/ skill with SKILL.md and examples/ subdirectory

best_practices: Use the standardized directory layout with .claude-plugin/plugin.json at the root and component directories at the same level
Always use ${CLAUDE_PLUGIN_ROOT} for all intra-plugin path references instead of hardcoded absolute paths
Keep plugin.json minimal and rely on auto-discovery for standard component locations
anti_patterns: Nesting component directories inside .claude-plugin/ instead of at plugin root level
Using hardcoded absolute paths like /Users/name/plugins instead of ${CLAUDE_PLUGIN_ROOT}
Manually registering components instead of using the auto-discovery mechanism

faq.question: What Claude Code versions support this plugin structure?
faq.answer: The standardized plugin structure with auto-discovery is supported in all recent Claude Code versions. Use semantic versioning in plugin.json for compatibility tracking.

faq.question: Are there limits on plugin size or component count?
faq.answer: Claude Code does not impose hard limits on plugin size. However, very large plugins may experience slower startup times during component discovery.

faq.question: How do I integrate this with existing Claude Code workflows?
faq.answer: Plugins integrate through the standard component system. Commands appear as slash commands, agents become available for task assignment, and skills activate based on context matching.

faq.question: Does this skill access or store user data?
faq.answer: No. This skill only provides documentation and guidance. It does not read, write, or store any user data or execute code on user systems.

faq.question: Why is my plugin component not loading?
faq.answer: Common causes include: wrong directory location, incorrect file extension, malformed YAML frontmatter, or missing SKILL.md file in skill subdirectories. Check file naming and locations match the documentation.

faq.question: How does this compare to other plugin frameworks?
faq.answer: This structure is native to Claude Code with built-in auto-discovery, manifest-driven configuration, and seamless integration with commands, agents, skills, and hooks. Other frameworks may require manual registration and different organizational patterns.
